theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS overproduction causing oxidative damage and vascular aging, highlighting ROS, antioxidant decline, and p66Shc role.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as a central driver of aging and systemic physiological decline via oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial ROS accumulation and SOD2 enzyme role in regulating oxidative damage and aging-related neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production imbalance and oxidative damage as key drivers of mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial superoxide radicals causing oxidative damage and lifespan limitation, with SOD2 as a protective factor.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS overproduction due to SDH mutations to oxidative damage and premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS generation causing mtDNA mutations and systemic mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial decay driven by oxidative damage feedback loops and antioxidant decline causing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial DNA instability and ROS overproduction causing oxidative damage and cardiac aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial calcium overload via TRPC3 causing ROS increase and mitochondrial dysfunction in renal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decline of mitochondrial protein quality control systems leading to accumulation of damaged proteins and dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dynamics (fusion/fission) as mechanisms maintaining protein quality and mitochondrial function in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial small heat shock proteins as chaperones maintaining proteostasis and extending lifespan by preserving mitochondrial function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on supramolecular organization of respiratory chain complexes stabilizing function and reducing ROS, linking structure to quality control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes caloric restriction promoting mitochondrial biogenesis and quality control, maintaining mitochondrial function and slowing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details decline in mitochondrial biogenesis and PGC-1 coactivators impairing mitochondrial function and contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Decline Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links age-related decline in Pgc-1α expression to reduced mitochondrial oxidative capacity and systemic metabolic dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Organelle Interaction Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondria-lysosome contacts regulating mitochondrial dynamics and oxidative stress, affecting stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Organelle Interaction Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitophagy dysfunction causing accumulation of damaged mitochondria and systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Organelle Interaction Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitophagy decline disrupting mitochondrial homeostasis and contributing causally to aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Organelle Interaction Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitophagy as a key mitochondrial quality control mechanism whose impairment accelerates aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA common deletion accumulation causing mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS increase, and SASP-driven skin aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation and tissue-specific dynamics contributing to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutation accumulation and clonal expansion in stem cells causing tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mtDNA mutations and deletions as causal drivers of aging and explores gene therapy to reverse mitochondrial defects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA mutations and polymorphisms causing mitochondrial dysfunction and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA copy number decline, mutations, and mitochondrial quality control disruption to ovarian aging and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Hyperfunction and Senescence Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial hyper-function in senescent cells causing increased ROS, morphological changes, and apoptosis contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Hyperfunction and Senescence Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial permeability transition activation causing apoptosis and immunosenescence linked to mitochondrial dysfunction.
